cards.name: Agrus Kos, Wojek Veteran
cards.text: Whenever Agrus Kos, Wojek Veteran attacks, attacking red creatures get +2/+0 and attacking white creatures get +0/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Lieutenant Kos has never met a group of recruits he could not inspire or a mob he could not quell.

cards.name: Auratouched Mage
cards.text: When Auratouched Mage enters the battlefield, search your library for an Aura card that could enchant it. If Auratouched Mage is still on the battlefield, put that Aura card onto the battlefield attached to it. Otherwise, reveal the Aura card and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Autochthon Wurm
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Trample
cards.flavor: The trainer awoke to begin the journey from the wurm's tail to its head. The sun was setting when she arrived.

cards.name: Barbarian Riftcutter
cards.text: {R}, Sacrifice Barbarian Riftcutter: Destroy target land.
cards.flavor:
"Riftcutters are suicidal anarchists, waving those lightning axes around so much that the walls are as likely to fall as their foes."
—Heruj, Selesnya initiate

cards.name: Bathe in Light
cards.text: Radiance — Choose a color. Target creature and each other creature that shares a color with it gain protection from the chosen color until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Truth shines even in darkness. Those who march on the side of truth walk always in righteous light."

cards.name: Belltower Sphinx
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever a source deals damage to Belltower Sphinx, that source's controller puts that many cards from the top of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Benevolent Ancestor
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
cards.flavor: Although the door is flimsy and the lock pathetically small, Josuri's family never fears the night outside.

cards.name: Birds of Paradise
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
cards.flavor: Long ago, birds of paradise littered the skies. Thanks to the city's sprawl, most now exist as pets of society's elite.

cards.name: Blazing Archon
cards.text:
Flying
Creatures can't attack you.
cards.flavor:
"Through the haze of battle I saw the glint of sun on golden mane, the sheen of glory clad in mail, and I dropped my sword and wept at the idiocy of war."
—Dravin, Gruul deserter

cards.name: Blockbuster
cards.text: {1}{R}, Sacrifice Blockbuster: Blockbuster deals 3 damage to each tapped creature and each player.
cards.flavor: Vendors hung cords heavy with roots and laid out boxes of salted meat, unaware of the fiery disaster swiftly approaching.

cards.name: Blood Funnel
cards.text:
Noncreature spells you cast cost {2} less to cast.
Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, counter that spell unless you sacrifice a creature.

cards.name: Bloodbond March
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a creature spell, each player returns all cards with the same name as that spell from his or her graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.flavor: The Golgari support a vast army because death never ends its soldiers' service.

cards.name: Bloodletter Quill
cards.text:
{2}, {T}, Put a blood counter on Bloodletter Quill: Draw a card, then you lose 1 life for each blood counter on Bloodletter Quill.
{U}{B}: Remove a blood counter from Bloodletter Quill.

cards.name: Boros Fury-Shield
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by target attacking or blocking creature this turn. If {R} was spent to cast Boros Fury-Shield, it deals damage to that creature's controller equal to the creature's power.

cards.name: Boros Garrison
cards.text:
Boros Garrison enters the battlefield tapped.
When Boros Garrison enters the battlefield, return a land you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {R}{W} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Boros Guildmage
cards.text:
{1}{R}: Target creature gains haste until end of turn.
{1}{W}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Boros Recruit
cards.text:
({R/W} can be paid with either {R} or {W}.)
First strike
cards.flavor:
"Look at this goblin, once wild, untamed, and full of idiocy. The Boros have given him the skill of a soldier and focused his heart with a single cause."
—Razia

cards.name: Boros Signet
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Add {R}{W} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor:
"Have you ever held a Boros signet? There's a weight to it that belies its size—a weight of strength and of pride."
—Agrus Kos

cards.name: Boros Swiftblade
cards.text: Double strike
cards.flavor: When the Boros Legion attacks, swiftblades enter the fray first. They pick off the archers and mages, softening the enemy front before the flame-kin and giants go in.

cards.name: Bottled Cloister
cards.text:
At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, exile all cards from your hand face down.
At the beginning of your upkeep, return all cards you own exiled with Bottled Cloister to your hand, then draw a card.

cards.name: Brainspoil
cards.text:
Destroy target creature that isn't enchanted. It can't be regenerated.
Transmute {1}{B}{B} ({1}{B}{B}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as this card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Transmute only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Bramble Elemental
cards.text: Whenever an Aura becomes attached to Bramble Elemental, put two 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Ravnica is a seamless urban tapestry, each city bleeding into the next. In abandoned corners, however, nature has begun to reclaim what it once owned.

cards.name: Breath of Fury
cards.text:
Enchant creature you control
When enchanted creature deals combat damage to a player, sacrifice it and attach Breath of Fury to a creature you control. If you do, untap all creatures you control and after this phase, there is an additional combat phase.

cards.name: Brightflame
cards.text: Radiance — Brightflame deals X damage to target creature and each other creature that shares a color with it. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.
cards.flavor:
"Let the pyres of the unbelievers light our way."
—Razia

cards.name: Caregiver
cards.text: {W}, Sacrifice a creature: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
cards.flavor: "The guilds each believe its way is right, but their ways only bring blood to Ravnica's streets and tears to Ravnica's families."

cards.name: Carrion Howler
cards.text: Pay 1 life: Carrion Howler gets +2/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: They chase tirelessly after the bone-carts that speed along the streets of the Plague Quarter.

cards.name: Carven Caryatid
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
When Carven Caryatid enters the battlefield, draw a card.
cards.flavor: So-called "old wood" is rare in deforested Ravnica. Statues carved from it are said to house the last of the ancient nature spirits.

cards.name: Centaur Safeguard
cards.text:
({G/W} can be paid with either {G} or {W}.)
When Centaur Safeguard dies, you may gain 3 life.
cards.flavor: Swift, strong, and selfless, the centaurs are the shields of the Conclave.

cards.name: Cerulean Sphinx
cards.text:
Flying
{U}: Cerulean Sphinx's owner shuffles it into his or her library.
cards.flavor:
"About the sphinx, I have mixed feelings. Their wisdom I crave, but their secrecy I can't tolerate."
—Szadek

cards.name: Chant of Vitu-Ghazi
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Prevent all damage that would be dealt by creatures this turn. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.

cards.name: Char
cards.text: Char deals 4 damage to target creature or player and 2 damage to you.
cards.flavor: Izzet mages often acquire their magic reagents from dubious sources, so the potency of their spells is never predictable.

cards.name: Chord of Calling
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Search your library for a creature card with converted mana cost X or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Chorus of the Conclave
cards.text:
Forestwalk
As an additional cost to cast creature spells, you may pay any amount of mana. If you do, that creature enters the battlefield with that many additional +1/+1 counters on it.
cards.flavor: "We are many, yet one. We are separate in body, yet speak with a single voice. Join us in our chorus."

cards.name: Circu, Dimir Lobotomist
cards.text:
Whenever you cast a blue spell, exile the top card of target library.
Whenever you cast a black spell, exile the top card of target library.
Your opponents can't cast nonland cards with the same name as a card exiled with Circu, Dimir Lobotomist.

cards.name: Civic Wayfinder
cards.text: When Civic Wayfinder enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: "These alleys are not safe. Come, I can guide you back to the market square."

cards.name: Cleansing Beam
cards.text: Radiance — Cleansing Beam deals 2 damage to target creature and each other creature that shares a color with it.
cards.flavor:
"Justice is toothless without punishment. Righteousness cannot succeed without the suffering of the guilty."
—Razia

cards.name: Clinging Darkness
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -4/-1.
cards.flavor: There's an experience worse than blindness—it's the certainty that your vision is perfect and the horror that there's no world around you to see.

cards.name: Cloudstone Curio
cards.text: Whenever a nonartifact permanent enters the battlefield under your control, you may return another permanent you control that shares a permanent type with it to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: It wants to remain a mystery, banishing the curious in favor of less inquisitive company.

cards.name: Clutch of the Undercity
cards.text:
Return target permanent to its owner's hand. Its controller loses 3 life.
Transmute {1}{U}{B} ({1}{U}{B}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as this card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Transmute only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Coalhauler Swine
cards.text: Whenever Coalhauler Swine is dealt damage, it deals that much damage to each player.
cards.flavor: Nothing stops industry in Ravnica—certainly not the safety of its workers.

cards.name: Compulsive Research
cards.text: Target player draws three cards. Then that player discards two cards unless he or she discards a land card.
cards.flavor: "Four parts molten bronze, yes . . . one part frozen mercury, yes, yes . . . but then what?"

cards.name: Concerted Effort
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, all creatures you control gain flying until end of turn if a creature you control has flying. The same is true for fear, first strike, double strike, landwalk, protection, trample, and vigilance.

cards.name: Conclave Equenaut
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Flying
cards.flavor: Equenauts are the seeds of the Conclave, scattered on the four winds, searching for new places to take root.

cards.name: Conclave Phalanx
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
When Conclave Phalanx enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life for each creature you control.

cards.name: Conclave's Blessing
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2 for each other creature you control.

cards.name: Congregation at Dawn
cards.text: Search your library for up to three creature cards and reveal them. Shuffle your library, then put those cards on top of it in any order.
cards.flavor: "It is fitting that we meet in the first hour of light, for we are called by the Conclave to pierce a threat of darkness."

cards.name: Consult the Necrosages
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Target player draws two cards.
• Target player discards two cards.
cards.flavor: Dimir rank and file never see nor hear their guildmaster. All orders are given through mysterious necrosages who appear from the shadows, tersely toss out a command, and then melt into the darkness.

cards.name: Convolute
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {4}.
cards.flavor: The words came to the sorcerer's lips but refused to budge any further.

cards.name: Copy Enchantment
cards.text: You may have Copy Enchantment enter the battlefield as a copy of any enchantment on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Simic mages create redundant backups of their experiments to reduce the consequences of catastrophe.

cards.name: Courier Hawk
cards.text: Flying, vigilance
cards.flavor: The Orzhov started using hawks as messengers in order to bypass the many toll roads and bridges that dot Ravnica. Soon the service became one of their most profitable businesses.

cards.name: Crown of Convergence
cards.text:
Play with the top card of your library revealed.
As long as the top card of your library is a creature card, creatures you control that share a color with that card get +1/+1.
{G}{W}: Put the top card of your library on the bottom of your library.

cards.name: Cyclopean Snare
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Tap target creature, then return Cyclopean Snare to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: The spoiled, gluttonous halls of the Orzhov teem with gaudy, needless wealth. Even their security measures are made for beauty first, efficiency second.

cards.name: Dark Confidant
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, reveal the top card of your library and put that card into your hand. You lose life equal to its converted mana cost.
cards.flavor: Greatness, at any cost.

cards.name: Dark Heart of the Wood
cards.text: Sacrifice a Forest: You gain 3 life.
cards.flavor:
"The soil here is rich with the rotting dead, and the sun's fingers barely penetrate the dark canopy. Plant our brethren here. This shall be our sanctuary."
—Savra

cards.name: Darkblast
cards.text:
Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
Dredge 3 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly three cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

cards.name: Devouring Light
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Exile target attacking or blocking creature.
cards.flavor: Into the light the good are welcomed, and with the light the evil are banished.

cards.name: Dimir Aqueduct
cards.text:
Dimir Aqueduct enters the battlefield tapped.
When Dimir Aqueduct enters the battlefield, return a land you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {U}{B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Dimir Cutpurse
cards.text: Whenever Dimir Cutpurse deals combat damage to a player, that player discards a card and you draw a card.
cards.flavor: Other guilds demand tolls from those who travel their territories, but not House Dimir. It takes its share secretly, one coin purse at a time.

cards.name: Dimir Doppelganger
cards.text: {1}{U}{B}: Exile target creature card from a graveyard. Dimir Doppelganger becomes a copy of that card and gains this ability.
cards.flavor: "Fear not. Your life will not go unlived."

cards.name: Dimir Guildmage
cards.text:
({U/B} can be paid with either {U} or {B}.)
{3}{U}: Target player draws a card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
{3}{B}: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

cards.name: Dimir House Guard
cards.text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
Sacrifice a creature: Regenerate Dimir House Guard.
Transmute {1}{B}{B} ({1}{B}{B}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as this card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Transmute only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Dimir Infiltrator
cards.text:
Dimir Infiltrator can't be blocked.
Transmute {1}{U}{B} ({1}{U}{B}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as this card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Transmute only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Dimir Machinations
cards.text:
Look at the top three cards of target player's library. Exile any number of those cards, then put the rest back in any order.
Transmute {1}{B}{B} ({1}{B}{B}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as this card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Transmute only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Dimir Signet
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Add {U}{B} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor: An emblem of a secret guild, the Dimir insignia is seen only by its own members—and the doomed.

cards.name: Disembowel
cards.text: Destroy target creature with converted mana cost X.
cards.flavor:
"We thought we found the victim's clothes lumped in the street. As it turned out, it was the victim, insides sucked out—just a sack of skin and robes."
—Agrus Kos

cards.name: Divebomber Griffin
cards.text:
Flying
{T}, Sacrifice Divebomber Griffin: Divebomber Griffin deals 3 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
cards.flavor: Justice flies swiftly on angry wings.

cards.name: Dizzy Spell
cards.text:
Target creature gets -3/-0 until end of turn.
Transmute {1}{U}{U} ({1}{U}{U}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as this card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Transmute only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Dogpile
cards.text: Dogpile deals damage to target creature or player equal to the number of attacking creatures you control.
cards.flavor: There is no shelter from this storm, its rain of fists, or the thunderous cackles of bloodlust.

cards.name: Doubling Season
cards.text:
If an effect would put one or more tokens onto the battlefield under your control, it puts twice that many of those tokens onto the battlefield instead.
If an effect would place one or more counters on a permanent you control, it places twice that many of those counters on that permanent instead.

cards.name: Dowsing Shaman
cards.text: {2}{G}, {T}: Return target enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: He combs the streets looking for the lost light, the discarded enigmas of the city.

cards.name: Drake Familiar
cards.text:
Flying
When Drake Familiar enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return an enchantment to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"Falconry? A fine sport I suppose, if you're attracted to the frailty of birds."
—Trivaz, Izzet mage

cards.name: Dream Leash
cards.text:
Enchant permanent
You can't choose an untapped permanent as Dream Leash's target as you cast Dream Leash.
You control enchanted permanent.
cards.flavor: The tendrils of sorcery find easy purchase on the soft underbelly of dreams.

cards.name: Drift of Phantasms
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
Transmute {1}{U}{U} ({1}{U}{U}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as this card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Transmute only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Dromad Purebred
cards.text: Whenever Dromad Purebred is dealt damage, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"I have seen much from the back of my dromad, most of it terribly wrong. The more I see, the more I am convinced of the rightness of my path."
—Heruj, Selesnya initiate

cards.name: Drooling Groodion
cards.text: {2}{B}{G}, Sacrifice a creature: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Another target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The Golgari expand, yes, but I refuse to call their tainted creations ‘growth.'"
—Veszka, Selesnya evangel

cards.name: Dryad's Caress
cards.text: You gain 1 life for each creature on the battlefield. If {W} was spent to cast Dryad's Caress, untap all creatures you control.
cards.flavor:
"I awoke to the face of beauty, my body fully healed. In that moment I knew my destiny was the Conclave's to shape."
—Rogad, Selesnya initiate

cards.name: Duskmantle, House of Shadow
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{U}{B}, {T}: Target player puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
cards.flavor: In a space where there is no room, in a structure that was never built, meets the guild that doesn't exist.

cards.name: Elves of Deep Shadow
cards.text: {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool. Elves of Deep Shadow deals 1 damage to you.
cards.flavor: Cast out of the Conclave generations ago, these elves found a home in the corrupted districts of the Golgari.

cards.name: Elvish Skysweeper
cards.text: {4}{G}, Sacrifice a creature: Destroy target creature with flying.
cards.flavor: The spires of Ravnica are no different from the tall trees of other planes. The elves navigate and protect them just the same.

cards.name: Empty the Catacombs
cards.text: Each player returns all creature cards from his or her graveyard to his or her hand.
cards.flavor: When the dead are laid to rest in Ravnica, it's usually just a nap.

cards.name: Ethereal Usher
cards.text:
{U}, {T}: Target creature can't be blocked this turn.
Transmute {1}{U}{U} ({1}{U}{U}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as this card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Transmute only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Excruciator
cards.text: Damage that would be dealt by Excruciator can't be prevented.
cards.flavor:
"Though used as a piercing weapon, the tusk is more akin to a stinger, spreading pain instantly throughout the body of its victim. This specimen deserves further study."
—Simic research notes

cards.name: Eye of the Storm
cards.text: Whenever a player casts an instant or sorcery card, exile it. Then that player copies each instant or sorcery card exiled with Eye of the Storm. For each copy, the player may cast the copy without paying its mana cost.

cards.name: Faith's Fetters
cards.text:
Enchant permanent
When Faith's Fetters enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.
Enchanted permanent's activated abilities can't be activated unless they're mana abilities. If enchanted permanent is a creature, it can't attack or block.

cards.name: Farseek
cards.text: Search your library for a Plains, Island, Swamp, or Mountain card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: "How truly vast this city must be, that I have traveled so far and seen so much, yet never once found the place where the buildings fail."

cards.name: Festival of the Guildpact
cards.text:
Prevent the next X damage that would be dealt to you this turn.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Everyone knows that violence at the Festival brings the worst of luck, so for at least one day a year arms are laid down in favor of brimming goblets.

cards.name: Fiery Conclusion
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Fiery Conclusion, sacrifice a creature.
Fiery Conclusion deals 5 damage to target creature.
cards.flavor: The Boros legionnaire saw a noble sacrifice, the Rakdos thug a blazing suicide, and the Izzet alchemist an experiment gone awry.

cards.name: Firemane Angel
cards.text:
Flying, first strike
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Firemane Angel is in your graveyard or on the battlefield, you may gain 1 life.
{6}{R}{R}{W}{W}: Return Firemane Angel from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.name: Fists of Ironwood
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Fists of Ironwood enters the battlefield, put two 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens onto the battlefield.
Enchanted creature has trample.
cards.flavor: Saprolings add the three and the four to the "one-two punch."

cards.name: Flame Fusillade
cards.text: Until end of turn, permanents you control gain "{T}: This permanent deals 1 damage to target creature or player."
cards.flavor:
"A single item acting as lantern and lance? Now that's military efficiency."
—Brev Grezar, Boros lieutenant

cards.name: Flame-Kin Zealot
cards.text: When Flame-Kin Zealot enters the battlefield, creatures you control get +1/+1 and gain haste until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Boros soldiers are like a cache of bombs ready to explode, and the flame-kin light their fuses.

cards.name: Flash Conscription
cards.text: Untap target creature and gain control of it until end of turn.  That creature gains haste until end of turn. If {W} was spent to cast Flash Conscription, the creature gains "Whenever this creature deals combat damage, you gain that much life" until end of turn.

cards.name: Flickerform
cards.text:
Enchant creature
{2}{W}{W}: Exile enchanted creature and all Auras attached to it. At the beginning of the next end step, return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control. If you do, return the other cards exiled this way to the battlefield under their owners' control attached to that creature.

cards.name: Flight of Fancy
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Flight of Fancy enters the battlefield, draw two cards.
Enchanted creature has flying.
cards.flavor: The view from above is an inspiration to the newly winged.

cards.name: Flow of Ideas
cards.text: Draw a card for each Island you control.
cards.flavor:
"A system to direct the flow of Ravnica's entire water supply? Thinking a bit small, aren't we?"
—Trivaz, Izzet mage

cards.name: Followed Footsteps
cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a token that's a copy of enchanted creature onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Æther can turn a footprint into a blueprint.

cards.name: Frenzied Goblin
cards.text: Whenever Frenzied Goblin attacks, you may pay {R}. If you do, target creature can't block this turn.
cards.flavor: The upside to not thinking about the consequences is that you'll always surprise those who do.

cards.name: Galvanic Arc
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Galvanic Arc enters the battlefield, it deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
Enchanted creature has first strike.

cards.name: Gate Hound
cards.text: Creatures you control have vigilance as long as Gate Hound is enchanted.
cards.flavor:
"Ditri, I leave this checkpoint in your capable teeth."
—Kitov, nightguard patrol

cards.name: Gather Courage
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Gaze of the Gorgon
cards.text:
({B/G} can be paid with either {B} or {G}.)
Regenerate target creature. At this turn's next end of combat, destroy all creatures that blocked or were blocked by it this turn.
cards.flavor: Even the dead give way to the mineral gaze of the gorgon.

cards.name: Ghosts of the Innocent
cards.text: If a source would deal damage to a creature or player, it deals half that damage, rounded down, to that creature or player instead.
cards.flavor:
"Ma said we should offer up blini-cakes and salt to the good ones, but I get that chill up my spine and just shut the door."
—Otak, Tin Street shopkeep

cards.name: Glare of Subdual
cards.text: Tap an untapped creature you control: Tap target artifact or creature.
cards.flavor: The righteous light of Selesnya is channeled through the devout, striking out to blind the nonbelievers.

cards.name: Glass Golem
cards.flavor: Izzet artificers have learned to steer their beautiful constructs clear of Boros warhammers—and the opera house.

cards.name: Gleancrawler
cards.text:
({B/G} can be paid with either {B} or {G}.)
Trample

cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Selesnya Sagittars can block an additional creature.
cards.flavor:
"What's their strike range, you ask? Let's put it this way: sagittars aim their bows using maps."
—Otak, Tin Street shopkeep

cards.name: Selesnya Sanctuary
cards.text:
Selesnya Sanctuary enters the battlefield tapped.
When Selesnya Sanctuary enters the battlefield, return a land you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {G}{W} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Selesnya Signet
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Add {G}{W} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor: The symbol of the Conclave is one of unity, with tree supporting sun and sun feeding tree.

cards.name: Sell-Sword Brute
cards.text: When Sell-Sword Brute dies, it deals 2 damage to you.
cards.flavor: "Killing is easy. Just wrap your hand around the haft, and wrap your enemy around the blade."

cards.name: Sewerdreg
cards.text:
Swampwalk
Sacrifice Sewerdreg: Exile target card from a graveyard.
cards.flavor: They hardly have form, dripping through pipe and grate with the slip and stench of flowing sewage.

cards.name: Shadow of Doubt
cards.text:
({U/B} can be paid with either {U} or {B}.)
Players can't search libraries this turn.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Your ignorance is my bliss."
—Szadek

cards.name: Shambling Shell
cards.text:
Sacrifice Shambling Shell: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
Dredge 3 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly three cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

cards.name: Shred Memory
cards.text:
Exile up to four target cards from a single graveyard.
Transmute {1}{B}{B} ({1}{B}{B}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as this card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Transmute only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Siege Wurm
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)
cards.flavor: The Rubblefield was once among the wealthiest districts in Ravnica. All it took was a single wurm to reduce it to ruins.

cards.name: Sins of the Past
cards.text: Until end of turn, you may cast target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard without paying its mana cost. If that card would be put into your graveyard this turn, exile it instead. Exile Sins of the Past.

cards.name: Sisters of Stone Death
cards.text:
{G}: Target creature blocks Sisters of Stone Death this turn if able.
{B}{G}: Exile target creature blocking or blocked by Sisters of Stone Death.
{2}{B}: Put a creature card exiled with Sisters of Stone Death onto the battlefield under your control.

cards.name: Skyknight Legionnaire
cards.text: Flying, haste
cards.flavor:
"I do not know which gives me more pride: the legions of soldiers marching in thunderous lockstep, or the cry of the skyknights riding their rocs like jagged lightning overhead."
—Razia

cards.name: Smash
cards.text:
Destroy target artifact.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Ravnica's laws protect not its citizens but its industry. Aging equipment is destroyed rather than restored, to bring more money into the factories' coffers.

cards.name: Snapping Drake
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: The irritable drakes are solitary nesters. Even brooding females barely contain the urge to attack their own young.

cards.name: Sparkmage Apprentice
cards.text: When Sparkmage Apprentice enters the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor: Pajik was amazed and pleased at his newfound powers. His pet cat Rivin was slightly less enthusiastic.

cards.name: Spawnbroker
cards.text: When Spawnbroker enters the battlefield, you may exchange control of target creature you control and target creature with power less than or equal to that creature's power an opponent controls.
cards.flavor: "The trick isn't setting up the bad trade. It's making each side think it got the better deal."

cards.name: Spectral Searchlight
cards.text: {T}: Choose a player. That player adds one mana of any color he or she chooses to his or her mana pool.
cards.flavor: The first searchlights were given as gifts, symbols of cooperation, to the emissaries present at the signing of the Guildpact.

cards.name: Stasis Cell
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
{3}{U}: Attach Stasis Cell to target creature.
cards.flavor: The Simic created the cells to preserve their experiments. The Azorius put the cells to use on the guilty.

cards.name: Stinkweed Imp
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Stinkweed Imp deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature.
Dredge 5 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly five cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

cards.name: Stone-Seeder Hierophant
cards.text:
Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, untap Stone-Seeder Hierophant.
{T}: Untap target land.
cards.flavor: Her touch brings to bare stone what water and sun bring to rich soil.

cards.name: Stoneshaker Shaman
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's end step, that player sacrifices an untapped land.
cards.flavor: There is no place in Ravnica for stagnation, no room for lands unfilled and untilled.

cards.name: Strands of Undeath
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Strands of Undeath enters the battlefield, target player discards two cards.
{B}: Regenerate enchanted creature.
cards.flavor:
"Why limit yourself to mortal law when you can outlive those who enforce it?"
—Czaric, Orzhov prelate

cards.name: Sundering Vitae
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor: Centuries of wind, rain, and roots compressed into an instant of destruction: such is the power of Selesnya.

cards.name: Sunforger
Sunhome Enforcer
cards.text:
Whenever Sunhome Enforcer deals combat damage, you gain that much life.
{1}{R}: Sunhome Enforcer gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Law soothed his savage heart. Where fury once burned, the enduring flame of order now shines."
—Razia

cards.name: Sunhome, Fortress of the Legion
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{2}{R}{W}, {T}: Target creature gains double strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Sunhome—the stalwart shield, the towering sentinel, the seat of justice.

cards.name: Suppression Field
cards.text: Activated abilities cost {2} more to activate unless they're mana abilities.
cards.flavor: The most feared of Azorius punishments is to be freed—sent back out into the world, stripped of all magical defenses.

cards.name: Surge of Zeal
cards.text: Radiance — Target creature and each other creature that shares a color with it gain haste until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"If only my poxes were as infectious as their zealotry."
—Savra

cards.name: Surveilling Sprite
cards.text:
Flying
When Surveilling Sprite dies, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor: Their natural curiosity, combined with a knack for trespassing, makes sprites excellent spies.

cards.name: Svogthos, the Restless Tomb
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{3}{B}{G}: Until end of turn, Svogthos, the Restless Tomb becomes a black and green Plant Zombie creature with "This creature's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard." It's still a land.

cards.name: Szadek, Lord of Secrets
cards.text:
Flying
If Szadek, Lord of Secrets would deal combat damage to a player, instead put that many +1/+1 counters on Szadek and that player puts that many cards from the top of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Tattered Drake
cards.text:
Flying
{B}: Regenerate Tattered Drake.
cards.flavor:
"Drakes embody the worst of Ravnica: great potential, twisted by selfishness and greed."
—Razia

cards.name: Telling Time
cards.text: Look at the top three cards of your library. Put one of those cards into your hand, one on top of your library, and one on the bottom of your library.
cards.flavor: Mastery is achieved when "telling time" becomes "telling time what to do."

cards.name: Temple Garden
cards.text:
({T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool.)
As Temple Garden enters the battlefield, you may pay 2 life. If you don't, Temple Garden enters the battlefield tapped.

cards.name: Terraformer
cards.text: {1}: Choose a basic land type. Each land you control becomes that type until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "This feels a little more like home."

cards.name: Terrarion
cards.text:
Terrarion enters the battlefield tapped.
{2}, {T}, Sacrifice Terrarion: Add two mana in any combination of colors to your mana pool.
When Terrarion is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, draw a card.

cards.name: Thoughtpicker Witch
cards.text: {1}, Sacrifice a creature: Look at the top two cards of target opponent's library, then exile one of them.
cards.flavor: "Once the brew gets the brains nice and pickled, they're a lot easier to pick through."

cards.name: Three Dreams
cards.text: Search your library for up to three Aura cards with different names, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor:
"Choose one to heal, one to harm, and one to grant you the prudence to use them."
—Miotri, auratouched mage

cards.name: Thundersong Trumpeter
cards.text: {T}: Target creature can't attack or block this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Hear that? Those notes mean we've arrived at Sunhome! Let our allies' hearts soar and our enemies' hearts shatter at the sound!"
—Klattic, Boros legionnaire

cards.name: Tidewater Minion
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{4}: Tidewater Minion loses defender until end of turn.
{T}: Untap target permanent.

cards.name: Tolsimir Wolfblood
cards.text:
Other green creatures you control get +1/+1.
Other white creatures you control get +1/+1.
{T}: Put a legendary 2/2 green and white Wolf creature token named Voja onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Torpid Moloch
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Sacrifice three lands: Torpid Moloch loses defender until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Market hucksters sell molochs for use as watchdogs. Of course, that's all molochs do. Sit around . . . and watch.

cards.name: Transluminant
cards.text: {W}, Sacrifice Transluminant: Put a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor: "Forget yourself. Forget your city. Forget your homes, your families, the debts and obligations that hold you to this world."

cards.name: Trophy Hunter
cards.text:
{1}{G}: Trophy Hunter deals 1 damage to target creature with flying.
Whenever a creature with flying dealt damage by Trophy Hunter this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Trophy Hunter.

cards.name: Tunnel Vision
cards.text: Name a card. Target player reveals cards from the top of his or her library until the named card is revealed. If it is, that player puts the rest of the revealed cards into his or her graveyard and puts the named card on top of his or her library. Otherwise, the player shuffles his or her library.

cards.name: Twilight Drover
cards.text:
Whenever a creature token leaves the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on Twilight Drover.
{2}{W}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Twilight Drover: Put two 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Twisted Justice
cards.text: Target player sacrifices a creature. You draw cards equal to that creature's power.
cards.flavor: In Otiev's mind, he ruled in favor of the accused. But in his courtroom he was only a spectator, watching his hand deliver the sign of death.

cards.name: Undercity Shade
cards.text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
{B}: Undercity Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Officially, there's nothing under that bridge to hunt . . . Unofficially, my torchers are too terrified to go there after nightfall."
—Agrus Kos

cards.name: Ursapine
cards.text: {G}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: A friendly ursapine means a constant supply of sharp spears. An unfriendly one means a constant supply of small holes.

cards.name: Vedalken Dismisser
cards.text: When Vedalken Dismisser enters the battlefield, put target creature on top of its owner's library.
cards.flavor:
"I crept up on him, quiet as a guttermouse. And then suddenly I found myself facedown in a latrine pit behind Tin Street Market."
—Sirislav, Dimir spy

cards.name: Vedalken Entrancer
cards.text: {U}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
cards.flavor: Their denial reaches far into your future.

cards.name: Veteran Armorer
cards.text: Other creatures you control get +0/+1.
cards.flavor: "Give me a sword and I'll kill a few enemies. But give me a hammer and a fiery forge, and I'll turn the tide of battle."

cards.name: Viashino Fangtail
cards.text: {T}: Viashino Fangtail deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor:
"When the bony terminus gets too large, it's shed from the tail in coinciding periods of heightened aggression and hunger."
—Simic research notes

cards.name: Viashino Slasher
cards.text: {R}: Viashino Slasher gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Citizens of Ravnica stick to the main streets. Shortcuts may look tempting, but down each alley, dozens of hungry hands await, and screams do not carry into the busy market throng.

cards.name: Vigor Mortis
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. If {G} was spent to cast Vigor Mortis, that creature enters the battlefield with an additional +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavor: After fear and weakness rot away, that which remains is stronger than its living form.

cards.name: Vindictive Mob
cards.text:
When Vindictive Mob enters the battlefield, sacrifice a creature.
Vindictive Mob can't be blocked by Saprolings.
cards.flavor: Many minds, a single madness.

cards.name: Vinelasher Kudzu
cards.text: Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on Vinelasher Kudzu.
cards.flavor: It grows to hate you.

cards.name: Vitu-Ghazi, the City-Tree
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{2}{G}{W}, {T}: Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: In the autumn, she casts her seeds across the streets below, and come spring, her children rise in service to the Conclave.

cards.name: Votary of the Conclave
cards.text: {2}{G}: Regenerate Votary of the Conclave.
cards.flavor: An ageless order, the votaries receive the gift of rejuvenation from the temple gardens they guard.

cards.name: Voyager Staff
cards.text: {2}, Sacrifice Voyager Staff: Exile target creature. Return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor: Voyager staffs are sought by those hoping to find an escape from the sprawling glut of Ravnica.

cards.name: Vulturous Zombie
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever a card is put into an opponent's graveyard from anywhere, put a +1/+1 counter on Vulturous Zombie.
cards.flavor:
"When something dies, all things benefit. Well okay, just our things."
—Ezoc, Golgari rot farmer

cards.name: War-Torch Goblin
cards.text: {R}, Sacrifice War-Torch Goblin: War-Torch Goblin deals 2 damage to target blocking creature.
cards.flavor:
"In a town shaped by the subtle machinations and political intrigue of its guilds, it's reassuring to see a goblin waving his torch and screaming about some nonsense or other."
—Agrus Kos

cards.name: Warp World
cards.text: Each player shuffles all permanents he or she owns into his or her library, then reveals that many cards from the top of his or her library. Each player puts all artifact, creature, and land cards revealed this way onto the battlefield, then does the same for enchantment cards, then puts all cards revealed this way that weren't put onto the battlefield on the bottom of his or her library.

cards.name: Watchwolf
cards.flavor: Only in Ravnica do the wolves watch the flock.

cards.name: Watery Grave
cards.text:
({T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool.)
As Watery Grave enters the battlefield, you may pay 2 life. If you don't, Watery Grave enters the battlefield tapped.

cards.name: Wizened Snitches
cards.text:
Flying
Players play with the top card of their libraries revealed.
cards.flavor:
"Be careful what information you ask them to find, for it will likely be the subject of tale time at the alehouse."
—Sirislav, Dimir spy

cards.name: Woebringer Demon
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices a creature. If the player can't, sacrifice Woebringer Demon.
cards.flavor: Each soul he devours adds its hunger to his own.

cards.name: Wojek Apothecary
cards.text: Radiance — {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature and each other creature that shares a color with it this turn.
cards.flavor: "A few arrows aren't enough to pierce your faith, soldier. You'll be back on the battlefield by sun's dawn."

cards.name: Wojek Embermage
cards.text: Radiance — {T}: Wojek Embermage deals 1 damage to target creature and each other creature that shares a color with it.
cards.flavor: "Your brother's crimes are your crimes. You stood by and lent support, so you too must face judgment."

cards.name: Wojek Siren
cards.text: Radiance — Target creature and each other creature that shares a color with it get +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: It is the call to arms, the call to fury, the call to blood.

cards.name: Woodwraith Corrupter
cards.text: {1}{B}{G}, {T}: Target Forest becomes a 4/4 black and green Elemental Horror creature. It's still a land.
cards.flavor:
"Its darkened sap penetrates natural fibers and spreads its own genes. Emulation experiments are underway."
—Simic research notes

cards.name: Woodwraith Strangler
cards.text: Exile a creature card from your graveyard: Regenerate Woodwraith Strangler.
cards.flavor:
"Nothing could be more natural than roots sucking nourishment from the dead."
—Savra

cards.name: Zephyr Spirit
cards.text: When Zephyr Spirit blocks, return it to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: A spiteful force exists on Ravnica that binds these ghosts to the land of the living but forbids them to touch it.
